fields.name: Advance Care Planning
fields.description: People with serious illness benefit by planning for a future where they are likely to get sicker so that they can communicate their preferences to their providers and caregivers. Advance care planning is a process that includes conversations about treatment preferences as well as wishes for end-of-life care. As part of the lung transplant evaluation process, people with CF are expected to complete an advanced directive. The CFF recommends routine advance care planning conversations once FEV1< 40
fields.content: People with serious illness benefit by planning for a future where they are likely to get sicker so that they can communicate their preferences to their providers and caregivers. Advance care planning is a process that includes conversations about treatment preferences as well as wishes for end-of-life care. As part of the lung transplant evaluation process, people with CF are expected to complete an advanced directive. The CFF recommends routine advance care planning conversations once FEV1< 40% predicted.

fields.name: Disability
fields.description: Disability, or Social Security Disability Insurance, is a program that pays benefits to individuals who have worked long enough and recently enough and paid Social Security taxes on your earnings. The Supplemental Security Income (SSI) program pays benefits to disabled adults and children who have limited income and resources.
fields.content: Disability, or Social Security Disability Insurance, is a program that pays benefits to individuals who have worked long enough and recently enough and paid Social Security taxes on your earnings. The Supplemental Security Income (SSI) program pays benefits to disabled adults and children who have limited income and resources.

fields.name: Tests
fields.description: Specific tests vary based on your age, medical history, how sick you are, the transplant program, and other factors. Some tests may be already completed as part of routine CF care and the transplant team will need to gather records. Tests may include: pulmonary function testing, blood tests, chest radiology (x-ray or CF scan), etc.
fields.content:
Specific tests vary based on your age, medical history, how sick you are, the transplant program, and other factors. Some tests may be already completed as part of routine CF care and the transplant team will need to gather records.

Tests may include: pulmonary function testing; blood tests; chest radiology (x-ray or CT scan); evaluation of your heart (echocardiogram and heart catheterization); evaluation for acid reflux and esophagus function; and cancer screening.

fields.name: Lung Transplant Evaluation
fields.description: The transplant team will outline a list of specific steps that you will need to finish before you can be placed on the waiting list. The steps will be a combination of tests, procedures, and visits with medical providers.
fields.content:
The transplant team will outline a list of specific steps that you will need to finish before you can be placed on the waiting list. The steps will be a combination of tests, procedures, and visits with medical providers.

The goals of the “evaluation” are to:

(1) Better determine how much you can benefit from transplant

(2) Identify conditions that could be optimized to improve your chance of success with transplant.

(3) Identify conditions that could make transplant too risky (contraindications)

fields.name: Survival Statistics
fields.description: Survival after lung transplant is tracked by multiple patient registries, including the CF Foundation, the United Network for Organ Sharing (UNOS), and the International Society for Heart and Lung Transplantation (ISHLT).   The ISHLT provides informa
fields.content:
Survival after lung transplant is tracked by multiple patient registries, including the CF Foundation, the United Network for Organ Sharing (UNOS), and the International Society for Heart and Lung Transplantation (ISHLT).

The ISHLT provides information on how long people from all over the world with various diseases lived after lung transplant. For people with CF transplanted between 1990 and 2018, half lived longer than 9.9 years after transplant, and half lived less than 9.9 years. The term for this is the “median survival”. In fact, 1 out of 4 CF lung transplant recipients has lived more than 20 years after transplant. ISHLT data also shows improving survival for lung transplant recipients with CF over time, with more recent transplants providing a longer survival benefit.

fields.name: BMI
fields.description: A measure of nutrition that incorporates a person’s height and weight. A BMI that is too high (obesity) or too low (malnutrition) can make transplant riskier. In fact, there are studies showing that people with obesity or malnutrition before transplant are at a higher risk for having a difficult recovery and worse survival after transplant. For this reason, many lung transplant programs set absolute cutoffs for BMI so that those who are moderately-to-severely underweight or being obese can be in
fields.content: A measure of nutrition that incorporates a person’s height and weight. A BMI that is too high (obesity) or too low (malnutrition) can make transplant riskier. In fact, there are studies showing that people with obesity or malnutrition before transplant are at a higher risk for having a difficult recovery and worse survival after transplant. For this reason, many lung transplant programs set absolute cutoffs for BMI so that those who are moderately-to-severely underweight or being obese can be ineligible for lung transplant. These thresholds are different at different programs across the country.

fields.name: Feeding Tube
fields.description: Feeding tubes can be temporary or more durable. Temporary feeding tubes may be inserted into the nose and go into the stomach or small intestine. More durable feeding tubes (e.g. PEG or G-tube) can be placed by surgeons, gastroenterologists or interventional radiologists and are typically connected to the surface of the skin on the left upper portion of the abdomen. Either type of feeding tube can be used to deliver liquid tube feedings.
fields.content: Feeding tubes can be temporary or more durable. Temporary feeding tubes may be inserted into the nose and go into the stomach or small intestine. More durable feeding tubes (e.g. PEG or G-tube) can be placed by surgeons, gastroenterologists or interventional radiologists and are typically connected to the surface of the skin on the left upper portion of the abdomen. Either type of feeding tube can be used to deliver liquid tube feedings.

fields.name: Support Group
fields.description: Support groups exist for people considering lung transplant and their caregivers. Many support groups have a virtual component (or are entirely online). Support groups offer the opportunity to learn about lung transplant from others who have gone through the process and to share your experiences before and after transplant.
fields.content: Support groups exist for people considering lung transplant and their caregivers. Many support groups have a virtual component (or are entirely online). Support groups offer the opportunity to learn about lung transplant from others who have gone through the process and to share your experiences before and after transplant.

fields.name: Caregiver
fields.description: Being a caregiver is a commitment. Lung transplant caregiver requirements vary by lung transplant program, but generally must be adults who are nonsmokers, able to drive, and able to stay at the hospital while the patient is recovering from the transplant surgery. Caregivers are useful for providing physical help – carrying/transporting medical equipment, delivering needed items to the hospital, and providing meals.
fields.content: Being a caregiver is a commitment. Lung transplant caregiver requirements vary by lung transplant program, but generally must be adults who are nonsmokers, able to drive, and able to stay at the hospital while the patient is recovering from the transplant surgery. Caregivers are useful for providing physical help – carrying/transporting medical equipment, delivering needed items to the hospital, and providing meals.

fields.name: Pulmonary Rehabilitation
fields.description: Pulmonary rehabilitation is a supervised program that includes exercise training, health education, and breathing techniques for people who have certain lung conditions or lung problems.
fields.content: Pulmonary rehabilitation is a supervised program that includes exercise training, health education, and breathing techniques for people who have certain lung conditions or lung problems.

fields.name: Wait List
fields.description: After being placed on the waiting list for lung transplant, individuals must be prepared to be called in for lung transplant at any time. Some people wait only hours or days and others wait years. The timing of “the call” depends on many factors including how sick the person waiting is, the availability of donor organs, and whether there are factors that make finding a match more challenging.
fields.content: After being placed on the waiting list for lung transplant, individuals must be prepared to be called in for lung transplant at any time. Some people wait only hours or days and others wait years. The timing of “the call” depends on many factors including how sick the person waiting is, the availability of donor organs, and whether there are factors that make finding a match more challenging.

fields.name: Carbon Dioxide
fields.description: Carbon dioxide is a toxin that can build up in a person’s blood when their lungs are not working normally.
fields.content: Carbon dioxide is a toxin that can build up in a person’s blood when their lungs are not working normally.

fields.name: BiPAP
fields.description: Bi-level positive airway pressure; this is a form of non-invasive ventilation that is used to help people remove carbon dioxide from their body. BiPAP is delivered by a mask on the face.
fields.content: Bi-level positive airway pressure; this is a form of non-invasive ventilation that is used to help people remove carbon dioxide from their body. BiPAP is delivered by a mask on the face.

fields.name: Travel Plan
fields.description: Transplant centers require lung transplant candidates to stay within a certain distance of the center at all times so they can arrive quickly if a donor becomes available. The distance varies from center to center. Most transplant centers require candidates to have a plan in place for how they will get to the transplant center once they receive the call for transplant.
fields.content: Transplant centers require lung transplant candidates to stay within a certain distance of the center at all times so they can arrive quickly if a donor becomes available. The distance varies from center to center. Most transplant centers require candidates to have a plan in place for how they will get to the transplant center once they receive the call for transplant.

fields.name: Pre-op Tests
fields.description: Pre-operative tests may be checked just prior to transplant to ensure a candidate remains healthy enough for the transplant surgery. The tests typically include blood work, imaging (e.g. chest x-ray), and testing for respiratory viruses (including COVID-19).
fields.content: Pre-operative tests may be checked just prior to transplant to ensure a candidate remains healthy enough for the transplant surgery. The tests typically include blood work, imaging (e.g. chest x-ray), and testing for respiratory viruses (including COVID-19).

fields.name: ICU
fields.description: Intensive Care Unit (ICU): Following a lung transplant, patients are closely monitored in the intensive care unit. Depending on how well the new lungs are working, people spend hours to days on the ventilator with a breathing tube (endotracheal tube) in place.
fields.content: Intensive Care Unit (ICU): Following a lung transplant, patients are closely monitored in the intensive care unit. Depending on how well the new lungs are working, people spend hours to days on the ventilator with a breathing tube (endotracheal tube) in place.

fields.name: Intubated
fields.description: Having a breathing tube (endotracheal tube) in a person’s windpipe (trachea) to allow connection to a mechanical ventilator for assistance with breathing. Some people are heavily sedated while others are able to be fully awake while on the ventilator, but this depends on multiple medical factors and how tolerant of the breathing tube the patient is.
fields.content: Having a breathing tube (endotracheal tube) in a person’s windpipe (trachea) to allow connection to a mechanical ventilator for assistance with breathing. Some people are heavily sedated while others are able to be fully awake while on the ventilator, but this depends on multiple medical factors and how tolerant of the breathing tube the patient is.

fields.name: Extubated
fields.description: Having the breathing tube (endotracheal tube) removed. Once extubated, a person breathes on their own without the assistance of the ventilator.
fields.content: Having the breathing tube (endotracheal tube) removed. Once extubated, a person breathes on their own without the assistance of the ventilator.

fields.name: Sepsis
fields.description: A severe, dangerous reaction that the body may have to an infection.
fields.content: A severe, dangerous reaction that the body may have to an infection.

fields.name: Sternum
fields.description: Commonly called the “breastbone.” It is the bone in the center of the front of the chest and connects the ribs to form the rib cage.
fields.content: Commonly called the “breastbone.” It is the bone in the center of the front of the chest and connects the ribs to form the rib cage.

fields.name: Restrictions
fields.description: In order to support healing of the broken sternum, or breastbone, lung transplant recipients are placed on sternal precautions or restrictions. These restrictions include limits on how the patient can move or twist and how heavy objects they carry can be.
fields.content: In order to support healing of the broken sternum, or breastbone, lung transplant recipients are placed on sternal precautions or restrictions. These restrictions include limits on how the patient can move or twist and how heavy objects they carry can be.

fields.name: Wires
fields.description: There are monitors for heart rate, blood pressure, and oxygen saturation that remain continuously connected initially. There are multiple types of intravenous (IV) lines/tubes.
fields.content: There are monitors for heart rate, blood pressure, and oxygen saturation that remain continuously connected initially. There are multiple types of intravenous (IV) lines/tubes.

fields.name: Discharged
fields.description: Allowed to leave the hospital.
fields.content: Allowed to leave the hospital.

fields.name: Oxygen Saturation
fields.description: The fraction of oxygen-saturated hemoglobin relative to the total hemoglobin in the blood. Oxygen saturation is normally 95-100%.
fields.content: The fraction of oxygen-saturated hemoglobin relative to the total hemoglobin in the blood. Oxygen saturation is normally 95-100%.

fields.name: Pulmonary Function Test
fields.description: The pulmonary function test most commonly used is spirometry. Spirometry measures how much air the lungs are moving (volume) and how quickly (flow). The FEV1 and FVC are two important measurements from spirometry that are tracked over time for people with a lung transplant.
fields.content: The pulmonary function test most commonly used is spirometry. Spirometry measures how much air the lungs are moving (volume) and how quickly (flow). The FEV1 and FVC are two important measurements from spirometry that are tracked over time for people with a lung transplant.

fields.name: FEV1
fields.description: Forced expiratory volume in one second; this is a lung function measurement that describes how much air is breathed out in one second when a person is blowing out as hard as they can. FEV1 is used post-transplant to monitor the function of the lung transplant.
fields.content: Forced expiratory volume in one second; this is a lung function measurement that describes how much air is breathed out in one second when a person is blowing out as hard as they can. FEV1 is used post-transplant to monitor the function of the lung transplant.

fields.name: Relocation
fields.description: Relocation after lung transplant is sometimes required by the lung transplant center. There are frequent doctor’s appointments scheduled early after the transplant. It is important to remain close to the transplant center so that you can be evaluated quickly if a complication arises.
fields.content: Relocation after lung transplant is sometimes required by the lung transplant center. There are frequent doctor’s appointments scheduled early after the transplant. It is important to remain close to the transplant center so that you can be evaluated quickly if a complication arises.

fields.name: Returning Home
fields.description: If a person relocates after transplant to be closer to the transplant center, multiple factors will influence the timing for returning home. The number and severity of complications after transplant, the strength of your support system, the distance to your permanent home, and how well you are managing the new medication and monitoring regimen will all be factors in the timing.
fields.content: If a person relocates after transplant to be closer to the transplant center, multiple factors will influence the timing for returning home. The number and severity of complications after transplant, the strength of your support system, the distance to your permanent home, and how well you are managing the new medication and monitoring regimen will all be factors in the timing.

fields.name: Supplemental Oxygen
fields.description: Supplemental oxygen is a higher concentration of oxygen that is prescribed to treat low oxygen levels.
fields.content: Supplemental oxygen is a higher concentration of oxygen that is prescribed to treat low oxygen levels.

fields.name: Nebulizer
fields.description: Nebulizers are drug delivery devices used to administer medication in the form of a mist inhaled into the lungs. Nebulizers are commonly used for the treatment of cystic fibrosis. Typically, people living with CF use nebulizers for hours each day prior to lung transplant.
fields.content: Nebulizers are drug delivery devices used to administer medication in the form of a mist inhaled into the lungs. Nebulizers are commonly used for the treatment of cystic fibrosis. Typically, people living with CF use nebulizers for hours each day prior to lung transplant.

fields.name: Immune Suppression
fields.description: The dampening of the immune system’s strength. Immune suppression is necessary so that the body accepts the transplanted organ. Immune suppression requires multiple medications, some of which require blood tests for monitoring levels.
fields.content: The dampening of the immune system’s strength. Immune suppression is necessary so that the body accepts the transplanted organ. Immune suppression requires multiple medications, some of which require blood tests for monitoring levels.

fields.name: Diabetes
fields.description: People with CF frequently have diabetes at the time of lung transplant and many go on to develop diabetes after transplant. The risk of diabetes is related to problems in the pancreas due to CF, but diabetes can also be induced by medications (e.g. prednisone) after transplant.
fields.content: People with CF frequently have diabetes at the time of lung transplant and many go on to develop diabetes after transplant. The risk of diabetes is related to problems in the pancreas due to CF, but diabetes can also be induced by medications (e.g. prednisone) after transplant.

fields.name: Insulin
fields.description: Insulin is a medication used to treat diabetes. Insulin is injected under the skin in response to measured blood sugar (blood glucose) levels.
fields.content: Insulin is a medication used to treat diabetes. Insulin is injected under the skin in response to measured blood sugar (blood glucose) levels.

fields.name: Dexcom G6
fields.description: Dexcom G6 is a brand of continuous glucose monitor. The Dexcom G6 has an associated app that gives real-time feedback about blood sugar (blood glucose) levels.
fields.content: Dexcom G6 is a brand of continuous glucose monitor. The Dexcom G6 has an associated app that gives real-time feedback about blood sugar (blood glucose) levels.

fields.name: Support System
fields.description: A support system can include family, friends, online support groups, and others. People in your support system can provide mental/emotional support as you deal with uncertainty or complications before and after transplant. A support system is also useful for providing physical help – carrying/transporting medical equipment, delivering needed items to the hospital, providing meals.
fields.content: A support system can include family, friends, online support groups, and others. People in your support system can provide mental/emotional support as you deal with uncertainty or complications before and after transplant. A support system is also useful for providing physical help – carrying/transporting medical equipment, delivering needed items to the hospital, providing meals.

fields.name: Complications
fields.description: Complications are common but are largely treatable and manageable. Complications after transplant may include bleeding, developing a lung collapse (pneumothorax), heart rhythm abnormalities (arrhythmias), or infections. The need for re-intubation (replacement of the breathing tube) for mechanical ventilation can also occur.
fields.content: Complications are common but are largely treatable and manageable. Complications after transplant may include bleeding, developing a lung collapse (pneumothorax), heart rhythm abnormalities (arrhythmias), or infections. The need for re-intubation (replacement of the breathing tube) for mechanical ventilation can also occur.

fields.name: Respiratory Failure
fields.description: Occurs when lungs can’t get enough oxygen into the blood.
fields.content: Occurs when lungs can’t get enough oxygen into the blood.

fields.name: Ventilator
fields.description: A machine that helps someone breathe.
fields.content: A machine that helps someone breathe.

fields.name: Trach
fields.description: An incision in the neck is made in order to insert a tube that brings air to the lungs.
fields.content: An incision in the neck is made in order to insert a tube that brings air to the lungs.

fields.name: Low Oxygen
fields.description: Some people living with advanced CF lung disease have low oxygen levels in the blood. Supplemental oxygen may be prescribed to treat low levels. It is typically delivered through plastic tubing from an oxygen tank or concentrator.
fields.content: Some people living with advanced CF lung disease have low oxygen levels in the blood. Supplemental oxygen may be prescribed to treat low levels. It is typically delivered through plastic tubing from an oxygen tank or concentrator.

fields.name: Transplant Center
fields.description: Certain hospitals that offer lung transplants.
fields.content: Certain hospitals that offer lung transplants.

fields.name: Antibiotics
fields.description: Antibiotics are used to treat infections caused by bacteria. They are used to treat worsened symptoms of illness (increased cough, sputum production, shortness of breath) and decrease in lung function (e.g. FEV1).
fields.content: Antibiotics are used to treat infections caused by bacteria. They are used to treat worsened symptoms of illness (increased cough, sputum production, shortness of breath) and decrease in lung function (e.g. FEV1).

fields.name: Drug Resistant
fields.description: Resistance to antibiotics is a common issue for people with CF. Bacteria changes in ways that can cause antibiotics stop working.
fields.content: Resistance to antibiotics is a common issue for people with CF. Bacteria changes in ways that can cause antibiotics stop working.

fields.name: Long-term Respiratory Care Facility
fields.description: Care is provided on an ongoing basis in a living situation by respiratory and physical therapists and nurses.
fields.content: Care is provided on an ongoing basis in a living situation by respiratory and physical therapists and nurses.

fields.name: Scans
fields.description: Such as a bone density scan and chest CT scan
fields.content: Such as a bone density scan and chest CT scan

fields.name: Colonoscopy
fields.description: Cancer screening is a part of transplant evaluation. A colonoscopy is a common exam to detect changes or abnormalities in the large intestine and rectum. A long, flexible tube with a camera is inserted into the rectum so a doctor can view the inside of the entire colon.
fields.content: Cancer screening is a part of transplant evaluation. A colonoscopy is a common exam to detect changes or abnormalities in the large intestine and rectum. A long, flexible tube with a camera is inserted into the rectum so a doctor can view the inside of the entire colon.

fields.name: Trikafta
fields.description: Trikafta is a medication that treats the abnormal protein that causes CF. Modulators are only effective for people with certain CFTR mutations.  Trikafta was approved in October 2019 for use in the United States among people 12 years or older with at least one copy of the F508del mutation of CFTR and is a highly effective CFTR modulator.
fields.content: Trikafta is a medication that treats the abnormal protein that causes CF. Modulators are only effective for people with certain CFTR mutations.  Trikafta was approved in October 2019 for use in the United States among people 12 years or older with at least one copy of the F508del mutation of CFTR and is a highly effective CFTR modulator.

fields.name: Pulmonologist
fields.description: A physician who specializes in respiratory illnesses like CF.
fields.content: A physician who specializes in respiratory illnesses like CF.

fields.name: Physical Therapy
fields.description: Exercise and movement is important for people with advanced cystic fibrosis for posture, airway clearance, and body pain.
fields.content: Exercise and movement is important for people with advanced cystic fibrosis for posture, airway clearance, and body pain.

fields.name: Lung Function
fields.description: Lung function is also known as FEV1: forced expiratory volume in one second; a measurement that describes how much air is breathed out in one second when a person is blowing out as hard as they can.
fields.content: Lung function is also known as FEV1: forced expiratory volume in one second; a measurement that describes how much air is breathed out in one second when a person is blowing out as hard as they can.

fields.name: Call
fields.description: After being placed on the waiting list for lung transplant, individuals must be prepared to be called in for lung transplant at any time. Some people wait only hours or days and others wait years. The timing of “the call” depends on many factors including how sick the person waiting is, the availability of donor organs, and whether there are factors that make finding a match more challenging.
fields.content: After being placed on the waiting list for lung transplant, individuals must be prepared to be called in for lung transplant at any time. Some people wait only hours or days and others wait years. The timing of “the call” depends on many factors including how sick the person waiting is, the availability of donor organs, and whether there are factors that make finding a match more challenging.

fields.name: Dry Run
fields.description: “Dry run” is the circumstance when an individual is called to the hospital for lung transplant but the surgery is cancelled, often due to unforeseen problems with the donor lungs.
fields.content: “Dry run” is the circumstance when an individual is called to the hospital for lung transplant but the surgery is cancelled, often due to unforeseen problems with the donor lungs.

fields.name: Airlift
fields.description: Medical transport services by air.
fields.content: Medical transport services by air.

fields.name: Pulse Oximeter
fields.description: A pulse oximeter is a small device that clips onto the finger and measures the level of oxygen in the blood.
fields.content: A pulse oximeter is a small device that clips onto the finger and measures the level of oxygen in the blood.

fields.name: Health-related Quality of Life
fields.description: Health-related quality of life can improve within a few months after transplant for individuals with CF.
fields.content: Health-related quality of life can improve within a few months after transplant for individuals with CF.

fields.name: Pain Management
fields.description: Opioid medications are prescribed for pain management after lung transplant.
fields.content: Opioid medications are prescribed for pain management after lung transplant.

fields.name: Anti-Rejection Medication
fields.description: Medications are necessary so that the body accepts the transplanted organ. Some require blood tests for monitoring levels.
fields.content: Medications are necessary so that the body accepts the transplanted organ. Some require blood tests for monitoring levels.

fields.name: Tacrolimus
fields.description: Tacrolimus is an immunosuppressive drug used after lung transplant to lower the risk of organ rejection.
fields.content: Tacrolimus is an immunosuppressive drug used after lung transplant to lower the risk of organ rejection.

fields.name: Mycophenolate
fields.description: Mycophenolate is an immunosuppressive drug used after lung transplant to lower the risk of organ rejection.
fields.content: Mycophenolate is an immunosuppressive drug used after lung transplant to lower the risk of organ rejection.

fields.name: Prednisone
fields.description: A corticosteroid
fields.content: A corticosteroid

fields.name: 6MWT
fields.description: The six-minute walking test (6MWT) is used to measure pulmonary function through walk distance, oxygen saturation and pulse rate during the walk, and breathlessness after the walk.
fields.content: The six-minute walking test (6MWT) is used to measure pulmonary function through walk distance, oxygen saturation and pulse rate during the walk, and breathlessness after the walk.

fields.name: Chest Tubes
fields.description: Chest tubes are placed during the lung transplant surgery to help drain air, fluid, and blood from around the lungs and to help the new lungs remain inflated.
fields.content: Chest tubes are placed during the lung transplant surgery to help drain air, fluid, and blood from around the lungs and to help the new lungs remain inflated.

fields.name: Bronchoscopy
fields.description: A bronchoscopy is performed by a pulmonologist so they can look at the lungs and air passages. A thin tube (bronchoscope) is passed through the nose or mouth, down the throat and into the lungs.
fields.content: A bronchoscopy is performed by a pulmonologist so they can look at the lungs and air passages. A thin tube (bronchoscope) is passed through the nose or mouth, down the throat and into the lungs.

fields.name: Hypercapnia
fields.description: High levels of carbon dioxide in the blood. Carbon dioxide is a toxin that can build up in a person’s blood when their lungs are not working normally.
fields.content: High levels of carbon dioxide in the blood. Carbon dioxide is a toxin that can build up in a person’s blood when their lungs are not working normally.

fields.name: Numbness
fields.description: Numbness can occur around the chest incision.
fields.content: Numbness can occur around the chest incision.

fields.name: Taste
fields.description: Altered sense of taste and smell can be side effects of medications.
fields.content: Altered sense of taste and smell can be side effects of medications.

fields.name: Hand Tremors
fields.description: Hand tremors are a relatively common post-transplant symptom.
fields.content: Hand tremors are a relatively common post-transplant symptom.

fields.name: Adherence
fields.description: The extent to which a person’s behavior – taking medication, following a diet, and/or executing lifestyle changes, corresponds with agreed recommendations from a health care provider.
fields.content: The extent to which a person’s behavior – taking medication, following a diet, and/or executing lifestyle changes, corresponds with agreed recommendations from a health care provider.

fields.name: Nutrition
fields.description: There are studies showing that people with obesity or malnutrition before transplant are at a higher risk for having a difficult recovery and worse survival after transplant. For this reason, many lung transplant programs set absolute cutoffs for BMI so that those who are moderately-to-severely underweight or being obese can be ineligible for lung transplant. These thresholds are different at different programs across the country.
